SEARCH
Package boundary

Class CoordinatorBoundary

java.lang.Object
utils.Base
boundary.BaseBoundary
boundary.UserBoundary
boundary.SupervisorBoundary
boundary.CoordinatorBoundary
public class CoordinatorBoundary extends SupervisorBoundary
CoordinatorBoundary is the Boundary layer for coordinators of the FYP in the system that interfaces with the Coordinator system actor and issue commands to other boundary and/or controller objects for execution of commands.
CoordinatorBoundary is extended from SupervisorBoundary as the Coordinator is also a Supervisor, hence would need its boundary attributes and methods which provides basic functionality for supervising system components.
Since:
15/4/2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeremy

    • CoordinatorBoundary

      public CoordinatorBoundary(CentralManager centralManager)

      Parameters:
      centralManager - CentralManager entity for the system

  • Method Details

    • coordinatorOperations

      public void coordinatorOperations()
      Method to display the coordinator operation choices at the CoordinatorBoundary (that is called at the UserBoundary only if it is the Coordinator). Then, after the Coordinator inputs her choice for which operation she wishes to perform, calls the respective method from the required controllers and performs it.

    • processSpecificRequests

      public void processSpecificRequests(String type)
      Processes requests of a specific type by delegating to the appropriate boundary method and prints a message indicating the type of requests being processed.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of request to process.

    • viewAllProjects

      public void viewAllProjects()
      Displays a list of all projects using the project boundary's "viewProjects" method.
      It prints out the 1. project ID, 2. project title, 3. Supervisor Name, 4. project status

    • getYesNoForFilter

      public boolean getYesNoForFilter(String prompt)
      Asks the user whether they want to filter by the specific criterion (prompt) with a message containing the specified criterion to confirm their filter choice.
      Parameters:
      prompt - prompt the filter criterion to be presented to the user.
      Returns:
      true if user inputs 'Y', false if user inputs 'N'

    • getFilterStatus

      public int getFilterStatus()
      Method to get the filter status if the coordinator wishes to filter projects with this status. Prompts the user with a message asking whether they want to filter by the selected status.
      If user answers 'Y', it proceeds to prompt the user which status he/ she wishes to filter by with the choices - Available, Reserved, Unavailable and Allocated. Based on his/ her choice, returns a unique integer with respect to the project status filter requested.
      If user answers 'N', it returns the integer '-3' to indicate that there is no status filter requested.
      Returns:
      integer indicating the status which the supervisor wishes to filter by, or if no status is request.

    • getFilterSupervisor

      public String getFilterSupervisor()
      Method to get the filter supervisor if the coordinator wishes to filter projects by this supervisor. Prompts the user with a message asking whether they want to filter by the selected supervisor. If user answers 'Y', methods gets the string representing the supervisor to filter by using the chooseSupervisor() method in the SupervisorBoundary object. If user answers 'N', this method returns a string containing '!' to indicate that there is no supervisor filter requested.
      Returns:
      a string representing the supervisor to filter by, or '!' if no supervisor filter is requested.

    • viewProjectsByFilter

      public void viewProjectsByFilter()
      Display projects with the filters requested by the coordinator by calling the displayProjectsWithFilter in the ProjectBoundary.

    • processAllPendingRequests

      public void processAllPendingRequests()
      Displays all pending requests and allows coordinator to choose requests to approve.

    • viewAllRequests

      public void viewAllRequests()
      Displays all requests made (regardless of status or request type)

    • displayMenuChoices

      public void displayMenuChoices()
      Display all menu choices that the Coordinator can make.
      Overrides displayMenuChoices from SupervisorBoundary. Prints out Supervisor choices first, then further prints Coordinator choices to create the full Coordinator menu.
      Overrides:
      displayMenuChoices in class SupervisorBoundary
